WRITING.TEXT: Wake him up, tell him how you feel. Most of the time when I have a panic attack just telling someone already helps..if he's your guy he will care! I see it's been an hour since you posted - are you okay now?
Made me smile #129303;
So cuuuute! He's chilling so hard after probably keeping the two of you awake the whole night... Hahah

Honestly if you feel like you don't want anyone in your life like you say, then just give in to that feeling and take some time for yourself! #9786; #65039; Ain't nothing wrong with that. 3 years is a long time and chances are that you have to reinvent yourself a little because being with a person for so lang probably had an influence on who you are and how you behave as a person.
Yes!! Was waiting for someone to give the second reason. Absolutely agree on this :)

In a Ted Talk Esther Perel (she is an awesome sexologist) once said that - if I remember correctly - most of the time the things that arouse us are the things that we do not love during the day, like having someone dominating you. Maybe this is why it feels morally wrong sometimes... During the day, you would not do or engage in the things that turn you on the most. And maybe this is even what makes them so exciting!! If you're interested, this is the Ted Talk - it is mostly about if you can desire something you already have, like a long term partner. Very interesting ! https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=sa0RUmGTCYY amp;t=519s
I have not but maybe you'll find the podcast "Where do we begin?" from Esther Perel interesting! They're all recordings from therapy sessions :)
Just wondering, what is it that you are scared of that will happen if you don't discuss it?
I found it on Spotify! Don't know if what's on there is different between countries though. It's called "Where should we begin" though, made a typo.

Right, well I think there is absolutely nothing wrong with telling hem that before you sleep with them! Actually, it makes perfect sense in my opinion. I can not tell you when the right moment is or when you 'should' tell them though. I think you have to decide that for yourself. Whenever feels right for you, is the right moment!
That's her page, yes! Can't find the podcast there though. Searched for "Esther Perel where should we begin" and found the first episode! https://youtu.be/8XemqwxWW8M

No, imo, it's more like: People who want sex, have sex. People who don't want sex, don't have sex. Nothing wrong with both of them. No excuses needed. This exact attitude that you're proposing right now is what makes a lot of people (including me) feel pressured to have sex, which leads to people not wanting sex...

WRITING.TITLE: Dead Bedroom from a LL perspective
WRITING.TEXT: Hi everyone! I have been reading this subreddit for a while now, because I (F23) feel like I am in a Dead Bedroom too. But, I am not the HL spouse, that's actually my partner (32M). I am the one that rejects her partner a lot because she does not feel like having sex. That does not mean that I do not want to have sex, though. I'm just afraid, worrying that I will not be wet enough or that after I agreed on having sex, I suddenly do not have the desire anymore and I have to disappoint my partner. So, I reject him. I know that this disappoints him too! It's just that I'm afraid I will disappoint him even more when I for some reason do not want to have sex anymore after initiating or consenting it. Also, the pressure that my partner puts on me by elaborating how important sex is to our relationship, makes me feel suffocated and only makes it worse. Now, the reason I am writing this post right now is that the way that some people talk about their LL SO made me feel like absolute shit. Like I am all that is wrong with this world and like I am deliberately trying to manipulate my partner and ruin my relationship. Made me really insecure. And of course I get it! There is a looooot of frustration going on behind the posts. But making an LL SO feel like shit will NOT make them want to have sex with you. Now I don't know everyone's story. A lot of you probably already did what I'm going to suggest, but for the one's who did not: try to talk to your LL SO about what the reasons are for them. Be kind to them. Work TOGETHER, not LL vs. HL. I have been crying for weeks. I hate that my desire is gone. Hate hate hate it! I want it back soooo badly. Last week I found something interesting on Reddit, that I wanted to try with my partner (CNC). BUT, I was so afraid that my partner would think that I had no right to want to try something because I am the LL SO and first I would have to give into his needs before I would have the right to try mine that I did not speak to him for 3 days. This worried me. Then, finally when I could not stop crying I told him. We had an awesome convo. About what he wants, what I want, and how we could discover TOGETHER what would help our sexlife. TLDR: I told this story partly to just get it off my chest, but also to ask everyone to please, please pleeaaaaseeee treat your loved one with kindness!! No matter if he or she is LL or HL, try to find it in your (maybe frustrated) heart to try to place yourself in their position and try to find a solution TOGETHER instead of LL vs. HL.

Let me see if I understand you: you think I am selfish for "denying his needs"? If that is the case, I absolutely do not agree with you. I don't think the reason why I should have sex with my SO should be because I want to meet his needs. The only reason for me to have sex with my SO, should be because I want to. And I don't think not wanting to have sex is selfish. I think the solution would be; to find something that makes me want to have sex again. The solution is not for me to just do something I do not want so I can meet his needs. I do agree with you that communicating about what the relationship needs is reeaallly important!

Did not think of that yet, you've got a good point there! Acknowledging the problem is such an important step. Seems impossible to solve a problem that is "not there". I am so sorry to hear that it went this way for you and that it did not work out for you and your husband.
Yes, thank you. Though meeting his needs is never gonna be solely the reason to have sex for me, I do think that it's really important and the fear of disappointing him kind of numbs me.

I feel that too, I really want us to tackle this together. I am attracted to my partner. Love him so much and I could cuddle and kiss him all day :D But, this is something that happened to me in every relationship. After a couple of months, my desire to have sex just disappears. Normally this wasn't a problem because I used to broke up with those partners when that happened. But this is the first really long term relationship I have ever had (2.5years) and now I have to fix something in myself that I do not understand, that really frustrates me and frankly, something that I never had to fix but could just ignore by breaking up.

This message made me smile. These are some interesting questions to think about. Indeed, I am really trying to work out why I do not want it. My partner does not want to see a therapist, but since this is a problem that I have had in previous relationships, I have decided that when this COVID is over, I am going to try to find a therapist for myself that could help me with this problem.

Yeah, that makes sense. Feels like there is a wall or blockage in my head between cuddling amp;kissing and sex. Thank you! I hope that you will find someone that will want to cuddle you all day, you sound like such a sweet person. :)

I think that's great! It can be hard to accept that you can only really influence your own problems and that you should first, before helping other people. But indeed I do think that is sooo important.
Aahw, you should believe them! Don't be so hard on yourself. :)
I think I don't really understand what you're saying. Do you think I should not have a romantic relationship, or that I should have told my partner that my desire will dry up?

I have ended it everytime this happens to me. Not purely because of that, also because of other reasons. But, now is the first time that I started to reflect on that fact and I'm trying to find out why this is.

Hmm, I definitely feel that it has to do with me becoming avoidant at some point. I did not expect it to happen in this relationship because the first year we had such amazing sex, unlike I have ever had with anyone else.

Thanks for your awesome reply. I can not do anything but agree 100% with your words. The last paragraph really got to me. Maybe the fact that I am trying to find a way for me to want more sex just so he would be happier with our sexlife is a big contributer to the problem of me not wanting sex. I think maybe I should ask myself the question 'Why would I want to have sex?" And try to find answers that are purely focussed on me.

You're talking about the attachment style here, right? :) I do not think I have an avoidant attachment style, but I do feel like my attachment might play a role in this. Very interesting topic, actually writing my thesis on attachment style and commitment in romantic relationships.
Gotta agree with you on that one

Actually, I have not communicated that... Which surprises me. And what surprises me even more is that I did not think about that untill you asked me. I definitely should communicate that. The pressure comes from the knowledge that he wants more sex than me.

Talk about it! I remember that I really (unintentionally) pushed my boyfriend to see how far I could go until he would walk away from me. I think I just needed to see that he would stay. Did not see that though until he pointed it out to me. Really thankful that he saw what I was doing and that he decided to talk to me about it.
Do it!

I am sorry to hear about your situation. And I totally get that this leads to so much frustration, and that that is the reason that some people are harsh on their SO. And you are right, being intimate is such a big part of a relationship. I agree with that. It makes a relationship a relationship...

Haha I get your reaction! I do not think it is something we should do right now, because of the exact reasons you state. But might be something we could try later on, or maybe just little parts of it. But you are right for asking! :)

Haha, this made me laugh. And yeah, you're right. But also, I feel like my self-awareness and my analysing my feelings might sometimes even make me my worst enemy because I tend to overthink a looooot.
Yeah, you're right! And maybe I should just introduce the idea of using lube more often when I have this doubty feeling. We did that once, worked really well.

Have you told your SO what you say in your second to last paragraph? My SO told me that being intimate with me is really important because for him it's me showing I love him, and that saying I do has a lot less effect than showing through being intimate. That really got to me. I mean I'm not there yet but it opened my eyes and got me started to trying to solve it.
I do realize that. And I do think about how he feels. And you are entitled to your opinion but I don't agree with your last sentence. Bot things could hurt just as much.

Alright well if you want to comment in a way that will help me, like so many others did, let me know. Right now it just seems like you want to call out on all the things I do wrong according to you, and on how terrible the things are that I do and nothing more than that. Of course if you think I'm wrong, and trying to be helpful is what you are doing, then I might have misjudged your text, so feel free to correct me.

What gets me in the mood sometimes is to sit by myself (so without my SO in sight, haha) and take the time to imagine all the things me and my partner (could) do together when having sex. 9/10 times that works. Also, my boyfriend and I have a groupchat with just us in it. It it solely meant for sexting. This reassures that a) the sexting won't be ruined by someone texting something about groceries for example and b) you can archive the groupchat so no one will be able to see it. I enjoy talking about what we would do to eachother. Also works when initially I am not in the mood, I just text him what he would want to do to me and that works. Don't get me wrong my sexlife is not perfect, I also struggle with getting in the mood. These are just two things that I found out really helped me! Remember that sexual desire never suddenly appears. Sometimes it may feel like it does, but there is always something triggering it. Always. So sometimes you just have to actively look for those things! :)
Interested #129392;
Yes, I used to have that. I think it was because my heart rate was too high. But also, right now after a run I immediately drink 500ml of isotonic recovery drink. I NEVER have a headache again!
Yes yes yes yes.
Not enough people saying stuff like this! Totally agree!
I have SO much respect for you telling your story!! #128588; #127996; #128588; #127996; You're helping people understand by doing this even if it's one person at a time, such a big difference!
Why I am a vegetarian.
Hahah, I get attacked from both sides: by vegans and by meat eaters #128514; just let me eat my cheese in peace please.
Yesss I loved this book so much!

First of all, stop comparing your relationship and sex life to those of others - especially because you have no knowledge of those sexlifes and are therefore comparing yours to one that is imaginary. Second, if you do not know why things aren't going the way you want them to, then that is where you have to start. Talk and communicate !! So important. And keep doing that until you reach a breakthrough because it can take a while before that happens. In those talks try to be honest and non-judgemental to each other. Also, try to go on a journey together to discover what it is that you guys find exciting and arousing! Doing that together will be fun and might bring you closer together and you might find some things that you'd want to try! And I think the most important thing is: sex should be fun. It should be enjoyable to the both of you! Find a way to make it fun for the both of you.
This comment went from comforting to extremely worrying real quick #128514;

I find the food analogy very relatable, speaking as a LLF. Also, that you do not understand the LL of your GF does not mean that it is not true for her. You don't have to fully understand it to work with it. Keep in mind that you're probably both suffering in this situation and try to fight the situation as a "we" instead of as a "you vs. me", which is something I see a lot around here. Of course if the partner does not want that, I get it. But I found that once my bf and I started to address this issue as a "we", it gave me room to breathe and while our sexlife is not where I want it to be yet, it's getting there step by step!

WRITING.TITLE: My friend annoys me by being too much, don't know what to do
WRITING.TEXT: Hi everyone! I (24F) need your advice on how to deal with this situation without being a huge ahole. I have a friend who is... A lot. She texts me all day every day with everything that goes on in her life, asks me an insane amount of questions through text the whole day. I am not a very texty person at all, I do not like to be on my phone all day, so I do not answer fast. And when I open my phone after an hour of not using it and I see 20 messages from her, it annoys me. I already told her this and she said she is fine with me not replying as long as she can send what she wants to tell, but she keeps asking me for replies and texts me question marks all the time. The thing I find most annoying though is that she thinks for me and does things for me (like figuring out whole dietary plans for me) without me asking or without me even wanting her to do those things. It feels sometimes as if she builds her life around me and clings to me, and sometimes she does things (like playing a certain videogame) not because she likes to do it, but because I do it and then she can do it with me. This feels a bit mean because I know that she does nothing to be mean or anything, but it annoys the shit out of me up until the point that I can feel irritable the whole day because of her texts. I have already discussed these things with her 3 times, but it seems as if she does not do anything with our conversations about the topic. At this point this friendship brings me more annoyance than joy, while this used to be a very very amazing friendship. I must add that these problems were always there, they just increased when COVID came. I don't want to be a bitch to her but I feel like I sometimes am, because the annoyance makes me cranky to her. What do I do? #128517;
This says it all #128079;
How's married life for you? :) (24F btw)

Hahaha #128514; You're probably just the closest and maybe only person for her to be annoyed with in these times (my BF certainly is... Poor guy now I come to think of it #129402;) so here you go. What do you do for a living?
